background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say filed by A.P.P. for State. Perused documents. Heard Advocate for applicants and A.P.P. for State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 438 of Cr.P.C. by applicants in respect of apprehension of their arrest in C.R. no. 795/18 registered at Hinjawadi Police Station for the offence punishable under section 328,323,506 read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, under section 12 of Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act and under section 23,75 of Juvenile Justice Act.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 23,75 of juvenile justice act

legalAct.actName: The Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act

arguments.text: It is alleged that father of victim boy aged about 10 years lodged report stating that firstly he married with Vidya Dhumal and victim is his son from first wife Vidya. After divorce he married with main accused Prajakta. Applicant no.1 is brother and applicant no.2 is father of main accused. Since marriage with main accused Prajakta, first informant, victim and main accused were residing together. Main accused was mentally and physically harassing victim. In August­2017 victim told that main accused gave him intoxicating medicine and did something to his private part. She used to show him obscene videos of Sunny Leoni and threatened to kill him if incident was disclosed. She was also harassing him by other ways described in First Information Report. She used to take victim at her parent's house Dist­Ahmednagar where present applicants used to harass victim by assaulting him and fearing him. They were not providing food to him in time. They were compelling him to work in their shop and agricultural land. They were concealing him in toilet and pressurizing him to hear his mother i.e. main accused. Main accused also filed offence punishable under section 498A of Indian Penal Code against first informant .

argumentSentences.text: It is alleged that father of victim boy aged about 10 years lodged report stating that firstly he married with Vidya Dhumal and victim is his son from first wife Vidya.
After divorce he married with main accused Prajakta.
Applicant no.1 is brother and applicant no.2 is father of main accused.
Since marriage with main accused Prajakta, first informant, victim and main accused were residing together.
Main accused was mentally and physically harassing victim.
In August­2017 victim told that main accused gave him intoxicating medicine and did something to his private part.
She used to show him obscene videos of Sunny Leoni and threatened to kill him if incident was disclosed.
She was also harassing him by other ways described in First Information Report.
She used to take victim at her parent's house Dist­Ahmednagar where present applicants used to harass victim by assaulting him and fearing him.
They were not providing food to him in time.
They were compelling him to work in their shop and agricultural land.
They were concealing him in toilet and pressurizing him to hear his mother i.e. main accused.
Main accused also filed offence punishable under section 498A of Indian Penal Code against first informant .

arguments.text: 3] According to applicants they are falsely implicated in this case. First Information Report is filed only with malafide intention to pressurize main accused to withdraw all proceedings against first informant. There is delay in lodging report. Applicant no.2 is 67 years old and has recently suffered Acute Coronary Syndrome and he is at present under medical treatment. He underwent coronary artery bypass graft surgery (CABG) on 04.01.2019 and he is advised to take bed rest. Applicants belongs to reputed family. Offence punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code, section 12 of POCSO Act are not applicable against them. They are resident of Savedi, Ahmednagar. They have no criminal antecedents. Due to levelling of offences punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code, under section 12 of POCSO Act and section 23 and 75 of Juvenile Justice Act, they have apprehension in their mind about their arrest. So, they prayed to grant protection under section 438 of Code of Criminal Procedure.

argumentSentences.text: 3] According to applicants they are falsely implicated in this case.
First Information Report is filed only with malafide intention to pressurize main accused to withdraw all proceedings against first informant.
There is delay in lodging report.
Applicant no.2 is 67 years old and has recently suffered Acute Coronary Syndrome and he is at present under medical treatment.
He underwent coronary artery bypass graft surgery (CABG) on 04.01.2019 and he is advised to take bed rest.
Applicants belongs to reputed family.
Offence punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code, section 12 of POCSO Act are not applicable against them.
They are resident of Savedi, Ahmednagar.
They have no criminal antecedents.

Due to levelling of offences punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code, under section 12 of POCSO Act and section 23 and 75 of Juvenile Justice Act, they have apprehension in their mind about their arrest.
So, they prayed to grant protection under section 438 of Code of Criminal Procedure.

arguments.text: 4] A.P.P. and I.O. objected application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Main accused Prajakta did not remain present in Hinjawadi Police Station in spite of notice under section 41(1)(a) of Cr.P.C. Applicants are originally resident of Dist­Nagar and it is necessary to investigate with them together. Applicants will pressurize victim and witnesses and there is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence and possibility of non­cooperating in investigation process. So, they prayed to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: 4] A.P.P. and I.O. objected application on the ground that investigation is in progress.
Main accused Prajakta did not remain present in Hinjawadi Police Station in spite of notice under section 41(1)(a) of Cr.P.C.
Applicants are originally resident of Dist­Nagar and it is necessary to investigate with them together.
Applicants will pressurize victim and witnesses and there is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence and possibility of non­cooperating in investigation process.
So, they prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: 5] From First Information Report and statement of victim role attributed to applicants can be gathered. As per statement of victim present applicants were asking him to do agricultural work, they used to beat him. Applicant no.1 i.e. his uncle was telling him to work in his shop and he was beating him if it was not properly done. He was also not providing meal to him. Other allegations with regard to offence punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code, section 12 of POCSO Act are against main accused i.e. his step mother Prajakta.

argumentSentences.text: 5] From First Information Report and statement of victim role attributed to applicants can be gathered.
As per statement of victim present applicants were asking him to do agricultural work, they used to beat him.
Applicant no.1 i.e. his uncle was telling him to work in his shop and he was beating him if it was not properly done.
He was also not providing meal to him.
Other allegations with regard to offence punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code, section 12 of POCSO Act are against main accused i.e. his step mother Prajakta.

arguments.text: 6] From documentary evidence filed by applicants, it revealed that they received notice on 12.12.2018, applicant no.2 is advised to take rest due to bypass graft surgery on 04.01.2019. Moreover, main accused Priyanka filed case under section 498A of Indian Penal Code and application under Domestic Violence Act against first informant. N.C. case is also filed by her. About incident which took place before August­2017 report is filed on 19.11.2018. No specific date of incident with regard to present applicants is mentioned. In such circumstances, considering medical ground of applicant no.2 and allegations against both applicants, custodial interrogation with them is not required. They are permanently resident of Savedi, Dist­ Ahmednagar, they have no criminal antecedents.

argumentSentences.text: 6] From documentary evidence filed by applicants, it revealed that they received notice on 12.12.2018, applicant no.2 is advised to take rest due to bypass graft surgery on 04.01.2019.
Moreover, main accused Priyanka filed case under section 498A of Indian Penal Code and application under Domestic Violence Act against first informant.
N.C. case is also filed by her.
About incident which took place before August­2017 report is filed on 19.11.2018.
No specific date of incident with regard to present applicants is mentioned.
In such circumstances, considering medical ground of applicant no.2 and allegations against both applicants, custodial interrogation with them is not required.
They are permanently resident of Savedi, Dist­ Ahmednagar, they have no criminal antecedents.

arguments.text: 7] Due to levelling of offences punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code and under section 12 of POCSO Act and section 23 and 75 of Juvenile Justice Act, apprehension in their mind is reasonable. Statement of victim is already recorded. Statement of victim does not show that these applicants insisted him to hear words of main accused. It appears that various proceedings are pending between main accused and first informant. Therefore, as there is no necessity of custodial interrogation, if some strict conditions are imposed regarding attendance, it will suffice the purpose. There is nothing on record to show breach of material condition by applicants. In view of all above reasons and due to apprehension in the mind of applicants, it is proper to grant protection to applicants. Therefore, following order is passed ­

argumentSentences.text: 7] Due to levelling of offences punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code and under section 12 of POCSO Act and section 23 and 75 of Juvenile Justice Act, apprehension in their mind is reasonable.
Statement of victim is already recorded.
Statement of victim does not show that these applicants insisted him to hear words of main accused.
It appears that various proceedings are pending between main accused and first informant.
Therefore, as there is no necessity of custodial interrogation, if some strict conditions are imposed regarding attendance, it will suffice the purpose.
There is nothing on record to show breach of material condition by applicants.
In view of all above reasons and due to apprehension in the mind of applicants, it is proper to grant protection to applicants.
Therefore, following order is passed ­

order.text: ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] The order dated 07.01.2019 below Exh.4 is hereby made absolute as follows ­ i] In the event of arrest in Crime no. 795/18 registered at Hinjawadi Police Station, the applicants Shridhar Marutrao Pathare and Marutrao Kundalikrao Pathare be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.25,000/­ each with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount 4 Cri.Bail Application no. 100-19 CNR-MHPU01-000401-2019 ii] The applicants shall not tamper the prosecution evidence in any manner. iii] The applicants shall attend Hinjawadi Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­sheet. iv] The applicants shall not meet victim, threat and pressurize victim. v] The applicants shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. vi] The applicants shall submit their address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number. vii] Inform to concerned Police Station accordingly.

footer: Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date – 11.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. processedText:
Cri.Bail Application no. 100-19 CNR-MHPU01-000401-2019 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say filed by A.P.P. for State. Perused documents. Heard Advocate for applicants and A.P.P. for State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 438 of Cr.P.C. by applicants in respect of apprehension of their arrest in C.R. no. 795/18 registered at Hinjawadi Police Station for the offence punishable under section 328,323,506 read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, under section 12 of Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act and under section 23,75 of Juvenile Justice Act. 
---background-ends---
It is alleged that father of victim boy aged about 10 years lodged report stating that firstly he married with Vidya Dhumal and victim is his son from first wife Vidya. After divorce he married with main accused Prajakta. Applicant no.1 is brother and applicant no.2 is father of main accused. Since marriage with main accused Prajakta, first informant, victim and main accused were residing together. Main accused was mentally and physically harassing victim. In August­2017 victim told that main accused gave him intoxicating medicine and did something to his private part. She used to show him obscene videos of Sunny Leoni and threatened to kill him if incident was disclosed. She was also harassing him by other ways described in First Information Report. She used to take victim at her parent's house Dist­Ahmednagar where present applicants used to harass victim by assaulting him and fearing him. They were not providing food to him in time. They were compelling him to work in their shop and agricultural land. They were concealing him in toilet and pressurizing him to hear his mother i.e. main accused. Main accused also filed offence punishable under section 498A of Indian Penal Code against first informant . 
---argument-ends---
3] According to applicants they are falsely implicated in this case. First Information Report is filed only with malafide intention to pressurize main accused to withdraw all proceedings against first informant. There is delay in lodging report. Applicant no.2 is 67 years old and has recently suffered Acute Coronary Syndrome and he is at present under medical treatment. He underwent coronary artery bypass graft surgery (CABG) on 04.01.2019 and he is advised to take bed rest. Applicants belongs to reputed family. Offence punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code, section 12 of POCSO Act are not applicable against them. They are resident of Savedi, Ahmednagar. They have no criminal antecedents. Due to levelling of offences punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code, under section 12 of POCSO Act and section 23 and 75 of Juvenile Justice Act, they have apprehension in their mind about their arrest. So, they prayed to grant protection under section 438 of Code of Criminal Procedure. 
---argument-ends---
4] A.P.P. and I.O. objected application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Main accused Prajakta did not remain present in Hinjawadi Police Station in spite of notice under section 41(1)(a) of Cr.P.C. Applicants are originally resident of Dist­Nagar and it is necessary to investigate with them together. Applicants will pressurize victim and witnesses and there is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence and possibility of non­cooperating in investigation process. So, they prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] From First Information Report and statement of victim role attributed to applicants can be gathered. As per statement of victim present applicants were asking him to do agricultural work, they used to beat him. Applicant no.1 i.e. his uncle was telling him to work in his shop and he was beating him if it was not properly done. He was also not providing meal to him. Other allegations with regard to offence punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code, section 12 of POCSO Act are against main accused i.e. his step mother Prajakta. 
---argument-ends---
6] From documentary evidence filed by applicants, it revealed that they received notice on 12.12.2018, applicant no.2 is advised to take rest due to bypass graft surgery on 04.01.2019. Moreover, main accused Priyanka filed case under section 498A of Indian Penal Code and application under Domestic Violence Act against first informant. N.C. case is also filed by her. About incident which took place before August­2017 report is filed on 19.11.2018. No specific date of incident with regard to present applicants is mentioned. In such circumstances, considering medical ground of applicant no.2 and allegations against both applicants, custodial interrogation with them is not required. They are permanently resident of Savedi, Dist­ Ahmednagar, they have no criminal antecedents. 
---argument-ends---
7] Due to levelling of offences punishable under section 328 of Indian Penal Code and under section 12 of POCSO Act and section 23 and 75 of Juvenile Justice Act, apprehension in their mind is reasonable. Statement of victim is already recorded. Statement of victim does not show that these applicants insisted him to hear words of main accused. It appears that various proceedings are pending between main accused and first informant. Therefore, as there is no necessity of custodial interrogation, if some strict conditions are imposed regarding attendance, it will suffice the purpose. There is nothing on record to show breach of material condition by applicants. In view of all above reasons and due to apprehension in the mind of applicants, it is proper to grant protection to applicants. Therefore, following order is passed ­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] Application is allowed. 2] The order dated 07.01.2019 below Exh.4 is hereby made absolute as follows ­ i] In the event of arrest in Crime no. 795/18 registered at Hinjawadi Police Station, the applicants Shridhar Marutrao Pathare and Marutrao Kundalikrao Pathare be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.25,000/­ each with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount 4 Cri.Bail Application no. 100-19 CNR-MHPU01-000401-2019 ii] The applicants shall not tamper the prosecution evidence in any manner. iii] The applicants shall attend Hinjawadi Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­sheet. iv] The applicants shall not meet victim, threat and pressurize victim. v] The applicants shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. vi] The applicants shall submit their address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number. vii] Inform to concerned Police Station accordingly. 
---order-ends---
Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date – 11.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment.
